description: The objective of this API is to make NASA data, including imagery, eminently accessible to application developers.

blocks.name: getPictureOfTheDay
blocks.description: This endpoint structures the APOD imagery and associated metadata so that it can be repurposed for other applications. In addition, if the concept_tags parameter is set to True, then keywords derived from the image explanation are returned.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: date
args.info: Optional: The date of the APOD image to retrieve. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default "today".

args.name: highResolution
args.info: Optional: Retrieve the URL for the high resolution image. Default false.

blocks.name: getClosestAsteroids
blocks.description: Retrieve a list of Asteroids based on their closest approach date to Earth.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Optional: Starting date for asteroid search. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default: "today"

args.name: endDate
args.info: Optional: Ending date for asteroid search. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default: 7 days after startDate.

blocks.name: getSingleAsteroid
blocks.description: Lookup a specific Asteroid based on its NASA JPL small body (SPK-ID) ID.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: asteroidId
args.info: Optional: Asteroid SPK-ID correlates to the NASA JPL small body.

blocks.name: getAsteroidStats
blocks.description: Get the Near Earth Object data set totals.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

blocks.name: getAsteroids
blocks.description: Retieve a paginated list of Near Earth Objects.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: The page number of the results. Default: 0

args.name: size
args.info: Optional: The number of returned results per page. Default: 20

blocks.name: getEPICEarthImagery
blocks.description: Retieve a paginated list of Near Earth Objects.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: date
args.info: Optional: Retrieve matadata for all imagery available for a given date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

args.name: availableDates
args.info: Optional: Retrieve a listing of all dates with available imagery.

blocks.name: getPatents
blocks.description: This endpoint provides structured, searchable developer access to NASAâ€™s patents that have been curated to support technology transfer.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: query
args.info: Optional: Search text to filter results.

args.name: conceptTags
args.info: Optional: Return an ordered dictionary of concepts from the patent abstract.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional: number of patents to return.

blocks.name: getSpaceSounds
blocks.description: This endpoint provides a series of space sounds via sound cloud.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: query
args.info: Optional: Search text to filter results.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional: number of patents to return.

blocks.name: getEarthImagery
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves the Landsat 8 image for the supplied location and date. The response will include the date and URL to the image that is closest to the supplied date.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: latitude
args.info: Required: Latitude.

args.name: longitude
args.info: Required: Longitude.

args.name: dimension
args.info: Optional: width and height of image in degrees. Default 0.025.

args.name: date
args.info: Optional: date of image; if not supplied, then the most recent image (i.e., closest to today) is returned. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

args.name: cloudScore
args.info: Optional: calculate the percentage of the image covered by clouds. Default false.

blocks.name: getEarthAssets
blocks.description: This endpoint retrieves the date-times and asset names for available imagery for a supplied location.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: latitude
args.info: Required: Latitude.

args.name: longitude
args.info: Required: Longitude.

args.name: begin
args.info: Optional: beginning of date range. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

args.name: end
args.info: Optional: end of date range. Format: YYYY-MM-DD. Default "today".

blocks.name: getMarsRoverPhotos
blocks.description: This API is designed to collect image data gathered by NASA's Curiosity, Opportunity, and Spirit rovers on Mars and make it more easily available to other developers, educators, and citizen scientists.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: sol
args.info: Optional: sol (ranges from 0 to max found in endpoint).

args.name: camera
args.info: Optional: Abbreviation of the camera.

args.name: page
args.info: Optional: The page number. 25 items per page returned.

blocks.name: getEONETEvents
blocks.description: This method returns most recent EONET (Earth Observatory Natural Event Tracker) events.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: source
args.info: Optional: Filter the returned events by the Source. Multiple sources can be included in the parameter: comma separated, operates as a boolean OR.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: Events that have ended are assigned a closed date and the existence of that date will allow you to filter for only-open or only-closed events. Omitting the status parameter will return only the currently open events.

args.name: days
args.info: Optional: Limit the number of prior days (including today) from which events will be returned.

blocks.name: getEONETCategories
blocks.description: This method returns EONET (Earth Observatory Natural Event Tracker) categories.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Optional: Filter the returned events by the Category.

args.name: source
args.info: Optional: Filter the returned events by the Source. Multiple sources can be included in the parameter: comma separated, operates as a boolean OR.

args.name: status
args.info: Optional: Events that have ended are assigned a closed date and the existence of that date will allow you to filter for only-open or only-closed events. Omitting the status parameter will return only the currently open events.

args.name: limit
args.info: Optional: LLimits the number of events returned.

args.name: days
args.info: Optional: Limit the number of prior days (including today) from which events will be returned.

blocks.name: getEONETLayers
blocks.description: This endpoint is a reference to a specific web service (e.g., WMS, WMTS) that can be used to produce imagery of a particular NASA data parameter. Layers are mapped to categories within EONET in order to provide a category-specific list of layers (e.g., the 'Volcanoes' category is mapped to layers that can provide imagery in true color, SO2, aerosols, etc.).

args.name: apiKey
args.info: Optional: Your ApiKey obtained from NASA for expanded usage. You do not need to authenticate in order to explore the NASA data. However, if you will be intensively using the APIs to, say, support a mobile application, then you should sign up for a NASA developer key.

args.name: categoryId
args.info: Optional: Filter the returned events by the Category.
